translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on Pairs, the Text on the Modes of Conveying

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽8.31. Ganthavippayuttaganthaniyaduka🔽Ganthavippayuttaṁ naganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto naganthaniyo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ganthavippayuttaṁ naganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto🔽naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ganthavippayuttaṁ naganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi       gantha vippayuttam na ganthaniyam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ na ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā gantha vippayuttam na ganthaniyam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ  na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā gantha vippayuttam na ganthaniyam dhamma
translated: The Pairs not Associated with Embodiment🔽With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers arises by way of root-cause condition. With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state associated with embodiment …

original: paṭicca ganthavippayutto naganthaniyo ca ganthavippayutto naaganthaniyo ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ na ganthaniyaḥ ca gantha vippayuttaḥ na a ganthaniyaḥ ca dhammā  uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers arises by way of root-cause condition.🔽With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers arises by way of root-cause condition.

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ naaganthaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam na a ganthaniyam dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers and a state associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers arise by way of root-cause condition.🔽With a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers as condition, a state not associated with embodiment and not subject to cankers arises by way of root-cause condition.

original: Ganthavippayuttaṁ naganthaniyañca ganthavippayuttaṁ naaganthaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ganthavippayutto naaganthaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: gantha vippayuttam na ganthaniyam ca gantha vippayuttam na a ganthaniyam ca dhammam paṭicca gantha vippayuttaḥ na a ganthaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is unconnected with the shackle and not subject to the shackle there arises a state that is unconnected with the shackle and not subject to the shackle, through a root-cause condition. … (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the section on root-cause, there are five; in the section on object, there are two; … in the section on non-hindrance, there are five. … (In each section, the method of exposition should be given in detail.)
The group of sections dealing with the shackle is finished.
